poem:
"Upon the Ebbing Tides of Power"

Matheson paces halls of power,
Imprisoned in his mistake tower,
Claims of excess ring in the ear.
The toll for folly proves severe.
Stripped of title, shorn of pride,
On a costly iPad ride.
Rising recklessness, now laid bare,
In the stern justice of Holyrood's stare.
And so fades the leader's day,
In whispers of wasted public pay.
